definition: to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold

sentences.english: I just enjoy watering plants and digging in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 我只是享受澆灌植物和在土壤中的挖掘。

sentences.english: I made reservoirs to water groves of flourishing trees.
sentences.chinese: 挖造水池，用以澆灌嫩小的樹木。

sentences.english: Only by working hard can we reap a bumper harvest.
sentences.chinese: 只有辛勤勞動才能澆灌出豐碩成果。

sentences.english: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time, with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
sentences.chinese: 自由之樹必須不時以愛國者與暴君的鮮血澆灌。

sentences.english: A reinforcing wire cage was dropped into the mold and concrete was then poured around it.
sentences.chinese: 鋼筋鐵絲籠放入模具中，混凝土隨即澆灌進來。

sentences.english: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你們必如葉子枯乾的橡樹，好像無水澆灌的園子。

sentences.english: The workers were pouring concrete for the bridge when the pier toppled.
sentences.chinese: 倒塌事故發生時，工人們正在給橋墩澆灌混凝土。

sentences.english: The red apricots on spring branches are the witness to your diligent sweat.
sentences.chinese: 看那枝頭紅杏春意鬧，是您辛勤的汗水澆灌。

sentences.english: Finally, they can be grown using rain-fed methods of production.
sentences.chinese: 最終，它們能通過使用雨水澆灌的生產方式來種植。

sentences.english: The voice I heard , like spring that swept my heart's drouth.
sentences.chinese: 那鐘聲像泉水澆灌我的心靈。

sentences.english: They are like seeds planted in good earth, watered and fertilized.
sentences.chinese: 他們如同撒進好土的種子，澆灌施肥。

sentences.english: You are a genetically manipulated seed planted in a field doused with artificial fertiliser.
sentences.chinese: 你是澆灌人造化肥的農田裏的一顆基因操縱的種子。

sentences.english: There would be a bunch of rose in everybody's mind and you didn't sprinkle your heart dried up only.
sentences.chinese: 每個人心裏都有一束玫瑰，只是你沒有澆灌乾涸的心。

sentences.english: HuangShangGu thinks that all the available books has a way of breaking away from mediocrity.
sentences.chinese: 黃山谷認爲要擺脫平庸，就要“用古今澆灌”。

sentences.english: Life is full of twists and turns, which requires us to be instilled with confidence.
sentences.chinese: 生活坎坎坷坷，需要自信的源泉澆灌。

sentences.english: For I will pour water on the thirsty land, and streams on the dry ground;
sentences.chinese: 因爲我要將水澆灌口渴的人，將河澆灌乾旱之地。

definition: no matter what/despite/to allow (sb to act arbitrarily)
copious/plentiful (of water)/surging (of waves)/refers to home village of first Han emperor 漢高祖|汉高祖[Han4 Gao1 zu3]/fig. majestic
